get.description: Port Channel Interfaces. Configure static and dynamic port channel interfaces

delete_object_type.name: object_type
delete_object_type.description: LOCAL - To delete local objects. SHARED - To delete shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

delete_scope_id.name: scope_id
delete_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

delete_persona.name: persona
delete_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_object_type.name: object_type
post_object_type.description: LOCAL - To create local objects. SHARED - To create shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

post_scope_id.name: scope_id
post_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_persona.name: persona
post_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_object_type.name: object_type
patch_object_type.description: LOCAL - To update local objects. SHARED - To update shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

patch_scope_id.name: scope_id
patch_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_persona.name: persona
patch_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

get_object_type.name: object_type
get_object_type.description: Retrieves LOCAL or SHARED or both(default) configuration objects.

get_scope_id.name: scope_id
get_scope_id.description: Configuration at a given scope. Mandatory for view_type = LOCAL.

get_persona.name: persona
get_persona.description: Filters configuration specific to given persona type. If not provided and view_type = LOCAL, then defaults to all persona.

effective.name: effective
effective.description: True - Returns effective configuration (i.e hierarchically merged configuration). False - Returns committed configuration at a given scope.

detailed.name: detailed
detailed.description: True - Includes annotations in the returned json to indicate the type of object, scope, and persona. False - Returns only config objects without annotations.

view_type.name: view_type
view_type.description: LIBRARY - Returns shared objects in library. For LIBRARY, all other parameters listed below, except 'detailed' , will be ignored. LOCAL - Returns configurations for a scope and one or more persona based on parameters below.

schema.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

schema.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

ArubaInterfacePortchannel_PortchannelsSc.description: Port Channel Interfaces. Configure static and dynamic port channel interfaces

ANY.description: Any of local or shared config object.

items.description:
List of physical ports attached to the port channel interface. All the ports in this list should
have the same link-speed. If the link is not established while creating a portchannel, then choose
a link partner that has same speed.

routing.description: Enable routing on the interface to make it layer-3 capable.

vrf-forwarding.x-typeDescription: Type definition for 'name', should be alphanumeric. Special characters such as '\', '/' and space are not allowed.
vrf-forwarding.description:
Add the interface to the VRF instance uniquely identified by its name.
This configuration is valid only on a layer3 interface.

x-enumDescriptions.LEARNED: On this port a MAC learn occurs.
x-enumDescriptions.REMOVED: On the enabled port a MAC is removed.
x-enumDescriptions.AGED: On the enabled port a MAC is aged out.
x-enumDescriptions.MOVED: On the enabled port a MAC is moved.

items.description: Define the events that the SNMP Trap will monitor

items.x-typeDescription: Comma separated list of VLAN IDs and ranges
items.description: List of trusted VLANs.

x-enumDescriptions.PROMISCUOUS: Configure the port to be a member of the primary VLAN.
x-enumDescriptions.SECONDARY: Set the port as a member of a secondary VLAN.
x-enumDescriptions.ISL: Extends the PVLAN domain across multiple switches.

pvlan-port-mode.description:
Port modes of private VLAN. Port with PVLAN(Private VLAN) port mode set to secondary or promiscuous
cannot trunk all VLANs. This config is not allowed on routed port.

items.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
items.description: Isolated VLAN ID for the interface.

items.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
items.description: Forbid vlans for interface.

macsec-policy.description: MACsec policy to use on the interface.

mka-policy.description: MKA policy to use on the interface.

vrrp-profile-apply.description: Apply VRRP-interface profile on an interface.

retain-port-profile-configs.description:
Controls whether profile configurations remain on the portchannel after
the profile is removed. When true, profile settings are preserved.
When false, the portchannel is deleted and the associated interfaces reset
to defaults. This leaf is automatically removed when a port profile is applied.

sw-profile-alias.description: Alias reference for port profile for this portchannel

sw-profile.description: Switch Port Profile (if any) associated with the portchannel.

ArubaInterfacePortchannel_AaaLagConfig.description: Top-level grouping for interface AAA configuration.

ArubaInterfacePortchannel_PortchannelCon.description: Grouping for the Port Channel (Aggregate) Interfaces.

items.description:
List of physical ports attached to the port channel interface. All the ports in this list should
have the same link-speed. If the link is not established while creating a portchannel, then choose
a link partner that has same speed.

routing.description: Enable routing on the interface to make it layer-3 capable.

vrf-forwarding.x-typeDescription: Type definition for 'name', should be alphanumeric. Special characters such as '\', '/' and space are not allowed.
vrf-forwarding.description:
Add the interface to the VRF instance uniquely identified by its name.
This configuration is valid only on a layer3 interface.

x-enumDescriptions.LEARNED: On this port a MAC learn occurs.
x-enumDescriptions.REMOVED: On the enabled port a MAC is removed.
x-enumDescriptions.AGED: On the enabled port a MAC is aged out.
x-enumDescriptions.MOVED: On the enabled port a MAC is moved.

items.description: Define the events that the SNMP Trap will monitor

items.x-typeDescription: Comma separated list of VLAN IDs and ranges
items.description: List of trusted VLANs.

x-enumDescriptions.PROMISCUOUS: Configure the port to be a member of the primary VLAN.
x-enumDescriptions.SECONDARY: Set the port as a member of a secondary VLAN.
x-enumDescriptions.ISL: Extends the PVLAN domain across multiple switches.

pvlan-port-mode.description:
Port modes of private VLAN. Port with PVLAN(Private VLAN) port mode set to secondary or promiscuous
cannot trunk all VLANs. This config is not allowed on routed port.

items.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
items.description: Isolated VLAN ID for the interface.

items.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
items.description: Forbid vlans for interface.

macsec-policy.description: MACsec policy to use on the interface.

mka-policy.description: MKA policy to use on the interface.

vrrp-profile-apply.description: Apply VRRP-interface profile on an interface.

retain-port-profile-configs.description:
Controls whether profile configurations remain on the portchannel after
the profile is removed. When true, profile settings are preserved.
When false, the portchannel is deleted and the associated interfaces reset
to defaults. This leaf is automatically removed when a port profile is applied.

sw-profile-alias.description: Alias reference for port profile for this portchannel

sw-profile.description: Switch Port Profile (if any) associated with the portchannel.

ArubaAaaProfile_AuthenticationLagAttribu.description: Group for authentication attributes which are supported on lag interface.

x-enumDescriptions.DEVICE_MODE:
The first authenticated client grants network access to all the other
clients.
x-enumDescriptions.CLIENT_MODE:
Each client must be authenticated separately to be granted network
access.
x-enumDescriptions.MULTI_DOMAIN:
Limit the number of authenticated clients to one 'voice' client and a
configured number of 'data' clients.

auth-mode.description:
The mode determining how each client on the interface can gain access
to the network.

allow-flood-traffic.description:
Enable transmission of flood traffic (broadcast, multicast and
unknown unicast) out authentication enabled interfaces with no
authenticated client.

client-limit.description: Maximum number of clients that can be authenticated on the interface.

lldp.description: Enable LLDP packets to trigger authentication.

cdp.description: Enable CDP packets to trigger authentication.

x-enumDescriptions.CHASSIS_MAC: Use the chassis MAC in LLDP TLV
x-enumDescriptions.SOURCE_MAC: Use the source MAC in LLDP frame

mac-type.description:
MAC address to use when authentication is triggered by an
LLDP frame. This is applicable only when LLDP packets are
allowed to trigger authentication.

bpdu-bypass.description:
BPDUs to be serviced by the device before authentication is
successful on the interface.

lldp.description:
Enable LLDP packets to be serviced by the device before
authentication is successful on the interface.

cdp.description:
Enable CDP packets to be serviced by the device before
authentication is successful on the interface.

bpdu-proxy-logoff.description:
Proxy logoff the client based on the interface status in BPDU packets.
Device will clear authentication session of the client if it receives
an interface down status in the BPDU packet.
When not configured, no action is taken.

x-enumDescriptions.NONE: Prevent an SNMP trap from being sent.
x-enumDescriptions.NOTIFY: Send an SNMP trap and log an event on a violation.
x-enumDescriptions.SHUTDOWN:
Send an SNMP trap, log an event and shut the interface down on a
violation.

action.description:
Action to take on a security violation (notify or shutdown).
This is only supported on physical ports.

shutdown-recovery-enable.description:
Enable auto-recovery of the interface. This is only applicable when
the violation action is set to shutdown.
The interface is re-enabled after the recovery timer has expired.

recovery-timer.description:
Time in seconds after which the interface is re-enabled if it was
shutdown in response to a violation event.
This is only applicable if shutdown recovery is enabled.

hello-delay.description:
Maximum time before a triggered PIM Hello message is transmitted on
the interface.

hello-interval.description:
Interval at which PIM Hello messages are transmitted on the
interface.

override-interval.description:
Value inserted into the Override Interval field of a LAN Prune Delay
option on the interface.

propagation-delay.description:
Value inserted into the LAN Prune Delay field of a LAN Prune Delay
option on the interface .

lan-prune-delay-disable.description: Enable LAN Prune Delay on this interface.

dr-priority.description:
Priority value to use on the interface in the Designated Router
election process.

datapath-auto-include.description:
When set to true, the router forwards multicast data received on the
vxlan l3 VNI fabric to this interface regardless of whether a multicast
join was received.

graft-retry-interval.description:
Interval for which router waits for Graft Ack before resending
Graft Request.

max-graft-retries.description: Specify the max Graft Request retry attempt.

bfd-enable.description: Enable BFD for PIM-DM on the interface.

enable.description: Enable PIM-SM protocol on the interface.

source-address-any.description: Any source address to be used for PIM IPv4 packets

source-address.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.
source-address.description: Source address to be used for PIM IPv4 packets

bfd-enable.description: Enable BFD for PIM-DM on the interface.

enable.description: Enable PIM-DM protocol on the interface.

source-address-any.description: Any source address to be used for PIM IPv4 packets

source-address.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.
source-address.description: Source address to be used for PIM IPv4 packets

ttl-threshold.description:
Multicast datagram TTL threshold for the
interface

bidir-enable.description: Enable PIM-Bidir protocol on the interface.

hello-interval.description:
Interval at which PIM Hello messages are transmitted on the
interface.

hello-delay.description:
Maximum time before a triggered PIM Hello message is transmitted on
the interface.

lan-prune-delay.description: LAN prune delay option on the interface for PIM Bidir.

override-interval.description:
Value inserted into the Override Interval field of a LAN Prune Delay
option on the interface.

propagation-delay.description:
Value inserted into the LAN Prune Delay field of a LAN Prune Delay
option on the interface.

enable.description: Enable PIM6-SM protocol on the interface.

source-address-any.description: Any source address to be used for PIM IPv6 packets

source-address.x-typeDescription:
An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.
source-address.description: Source address to be used for PIM IPv6 packets

bfd-enable.description: Enable BFD for PIM-DM on the interface.

enable.description: Enable PIM-DM protocol on the interface.

source-address-any.description: Any source address to be used for PIM IPv6 packets

source-address.x-typeDescription:
An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.
source-address.description: Source address to be used for PIM IPv6 packets

ttl-threshold.description:
Multicast datagram TTL threshold for the
interface

ArubaPimInterface_PimIfConfig.description:
Grouping for Protocol Independent Multicast(PIM) config
for the interface.

pim6-sparse.description: Configure IPv6 PIM Sparse Mode protocol.

boundary-acl.description:
Multicast Boundary ACL to filter all multicast data
and control packets

pim6-dense.description: Configure IPv6 PIM Dense Mode protocol.

ArubaPimInterface_PimBidirIfConfig.description:
Grouping for Protocol Independent Multicast(PIM) Bidirectional
config for the interface.

items.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.
items.description: IGMP static group address

items.x-typeDescription:
An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.
items.description: MLD static group address

ArubaMgmdInterface_MgmdIfCommonConfig.description: Grouping for common MGMD Configurations on interface

querier-enable.description: Enable IGMP/MLD Querier on this device.

query-interval.description: Sets the interval in seconds between IGMP/MLD queries.

last-member-query-interval.description:
The number of seconds between successive group-specific
query messages.

robustness.description: Set the number of times to retry a IGMP query.

query-max-response-time.description:
The number of seconds to wait for a response to an
IGMP query.

policy-in.description:
Ingress ACL to filter processing of IGMP reports
and leave messages received

ssm-map-policy-in.description:
Configure Source Specific Multicast map ACL on this
interface.

ArubaMgmdInterface_IgmpIfConfig.description: Grouping for IGMP Configurations on interface

snooping.description:
Enable IGMP snooping. Only one of igmp snooping, igmp proxy gigabit ethernet,
igmp proxy port channel or igmp proxy vxlan can be enabled

igmp-proxy.description: This leaf associates the interface with a globally configured IGMP proxy domain by reference.

querier-wait-time.description: Sets the interval in seconds between IGMP queries.

router-alert-check.description: Enables or disables IGMP Router alert check

version.description: The IGMP protocol version to use.

strict-version.description: Process only the selected IGMP version packets.

filter-unknown-multicast.description: Block Flooding of IPv4 Unknown Multicast Packets

snooping.description:
Enable IPv6 MLD snooping. Only one out of mld snooping, mld proxy gigabit ethernet,
or mld proxy port channel can be configured.

querier-wait-time.description: Sets the interval in seconds between MLD queries.

version.description: The MLD protocol version to use.

strict-version.description: Process only the selected MLD version packets.

items.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
items.description:
Monitor incoming multicast traffic
on the specified ports on the VLANs

items.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
items.description:
Drop incoming multicast traffic
received on the specified ports on the VLANs

items.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
items.description:
Forward incoming multicast traffic
received on the specified ports on the VLANs

ArubaMgmdInterface_IgmpSnoopingLagConfig.description: IGMP Snooping Configurations on LAG Interface.

ArubaMgmdInterface_MldSnoopingLagConfig.description: MLD Snooping Configurations on LAG Interface.

ArubaMgmdInterface_MgmdSnoopingLagConfig.description:
Grouping for Multicast Group Membership Discovery(MGMD)
Snooping Configurations on LAG Interface.

igmp-snooping-lag.description: IGMP Snooping Configurations on LAG Interface.

mld-snooping-lag.description: MLD Snooping Configurations on LAG Interface.

ArubaMgmdInterface_MgmdIfConfig.description:
Grouping for Multicast Group Membership Discovery(MGMD) config
for the interface.

igmp-proxy-eth.description:
Interface IGMP proxy on ethernet interface. Only one out of igmp snooping,
igmp proxy gigabit ethernet, igmp proxy port channel or igmp proxy vxlan
can be configured.

igmp-proxy-pchannel.description:
Interface IGMP proxy on port channel inteface. Only one out of igmp snooping,
igmp proxy gigabit ethernet, igmp proxy port channel or igmp proxy vxlan
can be configured

igmp-proxy-vxlan.description:
Interface IGMP proxy on VXLAN interface. Only one out of igmp snooping,
igmp proxy gigabit ethernet, igmp proxy port channel or igmp proxy vxlan
can be configured

mld-proxy-eth.description:
Interface MLD proxy on ethernet interface. Only one out of mld snooping,
mld proxy gigabit ethernet, mld proxy port channel can be configured.

mld-proxy-pchannel.description:
Interface MLD proxy on port channel inteface. Only one out of mld snoping,
mld proxy gigabit ethernet or mlod proxy port channel can be configured.

access-group-vlan-id.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN

ArubaInterfaceCommon_PortchannelProfileC.description: Shared grouping for CX config parameters common to portchannel and port-profile yangs.

x-enumDescriptions.TRUNK: Manual static trunk that does not use LACP protocol.
x-enumDescriptions.MULTI_CHASSIS_STATIC: Static multi-chassis LAG which does not use LACP

trunk-type.description:
Type of trunk.
 For gateways, the aggregation types supported are TRUNK for static and LACP for dynamic.
 The change of LAG type is not allowed without deleting the members in it. All the members need to be
 deleted before changing the LAG type

x-enumDescriptions.LEARN:
Accept join requests for new VLANs on this port and
 propagate requests through all other forwarding ports
 that are participating in GVRP.
x-enumDescriptions.BLOCK:
Only process GVRP packets that concern themselves with
 known VLANs and ignore new VLANs.

unknown-vlans.x-typeDescription: Unknown VLANs handling mode for GVRP on port channel interfaces.
unknown-vlans.description:
Configure GVRP unknown VLANs handling mode for port channel interface.
 Learn: Accept join requests for new VLANs and propagate through GVRP.
 Block: Process GVRP packets for known VLANs only, ignore new VLANs.
 Disable: Ignore all GVRP packets.

access-group-session.description: Session based policy for inbound traffic.

access-group-vlan-in.description: Policy for inbound routed and bridged traffic.

access-group-vlan-out.description: Policy for outbound routed and bridged traffic.

ip.description: IP configuration. This configuration is valid only on a layer3 interface.

mtu.description:
IP MTU of an interface in bytes. The IP MTU is the largest IP packet that can be sent by the interface.
This value should be less than or equal to the overall MTU for the interface.

l3-counters.x-typeDescription: Enable Rx and Tx L3 counters on Tunnel interface.

x-enumDescriptions.TX_ONLY:
Enable interface to only transmit voice VLAN CDP(Cisco Discovery Protocol)
packets.CDP packets will not be received.
x-enumDescriptions.RX_ONLY:
Enable interface to only receive voice VLAN CDP(Cisco Discovery Protocol)
packets.CDP packets will not be transmitted.
x-enumDescriptions.TX_RX:
Enable interface to both transmit and receive voice VLAN CDP(Cisco Discovery Protocol)
packets.
x-enumDescriptions.TX_ONLY_ON_VOICE_RX:
Enable interface to transmit CDP(Cisco Discovery Protocol) packets
only on reception of Voice VLAN query.
x-enumDescriptions.DISABLE: Disable both transmit and receive for voice VLAN CDP(Cisco Discovery Protocol) packets.

mode.x-typeDescription: CDP pre-std-voice mode on this interface.

ipv4.description: IPv4 configuration. This configuration is valid only on a layer3 interface.

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 prefix represented in dotted quad notation followed by
a slash and a CIDR mask (0 <= mask <= 32).
Dynamic client type to obtain IPv4 address.

address.description: Set an IPv4 address (static) or enable DHCPv4 client (dynamic).

items.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 prefix represented in dotted quad notation followed by
a slash and a CIDR mask (0 <= mask <= 32).
items.description: List of secondary IPv4 addresses with netmask specified.

dhcp-client-id.description: DHCP client identifier, applicable only when address field is configured as DHCP client.

filter-broadcast-helper.description: Filter DHCP broadcast packets when helper address is configured.

items.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.
items.description: This list is now deprecated. Please use the configuration from aruba-dhcp-relay.yang.

x-enumDescriptions.GATEWAY: Gateway responds to ARP requests with its own MAC address.
x-enumDescriptions.CLIENT: Gateway responds to ARP requests with client's MAC address.

proxy-arp.description:
Enable proxy ARP.
Possible values:
CLIENT: Enables proxy ARP in CLIENT mode.
        Gateway responds to ARP requests with client's MAC address.
GATEWAY: Enables proxy ARP in GATEWAY mode.
         Gateway responds to ARP requests with its own MAC address.

nat-inside.description: NAT inside for all routed traffic.

nat-outside.description: NAT outside for all routed traffic.

route-redistribute.description: Redistribute the connected route to ORO.

suppress-arp.description:
Suppress Address Resolution Protocol (ARP), when enabled the device will stop the flooding of unknown
requests to other nodes in the same VLAN.

vrf-forwarding.x-typeDescription: Type definition for 'name', should be alphanumeric. Special characters such as '\', '/' and space are not allowed.
vrf-forwarding.description: Add the interface to the VRF instance uniquely identified by its name.

dhcps-profile-name.description: Server profile name configured with DHCPv4 pools.

ip-directed-broadcast-enable.description: Enable IP Directed Broadcast on the interface. This configuration is valid only on a layer3 interface.

ipv6.description: IPv6 configurations. This configuration is valid only on a layer3 interface.

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv6 prefix represented in full, shortened, or mixed
shortened format followed by a slash and CIDR mask
(0 <= mask <= 128).

x-enumDescriptions.DHCP_FULL: Obtain IPv6 address & Configuration information from DHCPv6 server.
x-enumDescriptions.DHCP_FULL_RAPID_COMMIT: Obtain IPv6 address quickly from DHCPv6 server.

oneOf.x-typeDescription: Dynamic client type to obtain IPv6 address.

eui64.description: IPv6 address in the EUI-64 bit format. This config cannot be set when IPv6 DHCP client is enabled.

prefix-delegation-mode.description:
Prefix delegation mode. If an IPv6 helper address configured on this interface,
it cannot co-exist with powered device (PD) configurations.

pd-address.description:
The IPv6 PD based name and subnet/host ID. Maximum count(3) of configurable IPv6 addresses
and cannot co-exist with PD based address configurations.

pd-address-name.description: The IPv6 PD Name and the PD subnet/host ID is required.

subnet-host-id.description: The IPv6 PD subnet and host Identifier. The PD based name is required.

filter-multicast-helper.description:
Filteration of DHCP multicast
packets when helper address is configured.

helper.description:
The IPv6 helper. At least one IPv6 address should be configured to enable helper.
If PD mode is enabled on this interface, it cannot co-exist with helper configurations.

address.x-typeDescription:
An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.
address.description: The IPv6 helper address. Source field is mandatory since multiple IPv6 addresses exist.

source.x-typeDescription:
An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.
source.description: The IPv6 helper source interface address.

autoconfig.description: Enable automatic IPv6 address configuration based on IPv6 RA advertisements.

link-local.x-typeDescription:
An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

enable-default-link-local.description: Enable auto-generated IPv6 link local address.

dhcps-profile-name.description: Server profile name configured with DHCPv6 pools.

ArubaInterfaceCommon_SflowConfig.description: Interface level Grouping for Sampled Flow(sFlow).

enable.description: Enable sFlow for polling and sampling on an interface.

switchport.description: Switchport configuration. This configuration is valid only on a layer2 interface.

interface-mode.description:
Interface access or trunk mode for VLANs.
The access-vlan should be set to null for configuring trunk mode and
native-vlan, trunk-vlan-ranges and trunk-vlan-all should be set to null while configuring access mode
Eg: switchport: {interface-mode: ACCESS, access-vlan: 600, native-vlan: null,
trunk-vlan-all: null, trunk-vlan-ranges: null}
switchport: {interface-mode: TRUNK, access-vlan: null, native-vlan: NATIVE_VLAN,
trunk-vlan-all: false, trunk-vlan-ranges: [ 1000 ]}

native-vlan.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
native-vlan.description:
Native VLAN id for untagged frames arriving on
a trunk interface.  Tagged frames sent on an interface
configured with a native VLAN should have their tags
stripped prior to transmission. This configuration is only
valid on a trunk interface.

tag.description:
This configuration is only valid on a trunk interface and the configured interface
does not accept untagged frames coming in and configured to be tagged on all VLANs.

access-vlan.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
access-vlan.description: Assign the access VLAN to the access port.

trunk-vlan-all.description: When interface mode is trunk allow all VLANs for trunk mode interface.

items.x-typeDescription:
VLANs or only single-tagged VLANs or both. A range is
specified as x-y where x and y are valid VLAN IDs
(1 <= vlan-id <= 4094). The range is assumed to be inclusive,
such that any VLAN-ID matching x <= VLAN-ID <= y falls within
the range.
items.description: VLAN ranges that the interface may carry when in trunk mode.

origin.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
origin.description:
A port with a VLAN translation configuration allows traffic only for the translated VLAN and the native VLAN;
if it is a member of more VLANS, it does not allow traffic for them.
A translated VLAN must be present on the switch before the rule is created; the original VLAN need not be present.
VLAN translation and MVRP cannot be enabled on the same interface.

translated.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
translated.description: Translated VLAN identifier and not allowed on native VLAN 1.

ArubaInterfaceCommon_LoopProtectConfigBa.description:
Top-level container for basic loop protect configuration. This is split in two
grouping as CX and PVOS devices have some of these in global context.

enable.description: Enables loop protect on the L2/vxlan interface.

x-enumDescriptions.TX_DISABLE: Disables sending port when loop is detected.
x-enumDescriptions.RX_DISABLE: Disables receiving port when loop is detected.
x-enumDescriptions.TX_RX_DISABLE: Disables both sending and receiving ports when loop is detected.

items.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
items.description: List of VLANs for sending loop-protect pdus for a port.

ArubaInterfaceCommon_LoopProtectConfigAd.description:
Top-level container for advanced loop protect configuration. This is split in two
grouping as CX and PVOS devices have some of these in global context.

re-enable-timer.description: Time interval for enabling port blocked by loop-protect.

trap.description: Enable generating loop-protect traps when a loop is detected.

cost.description: Cost of the port for the instance.

priority.description: Port priority. For CX and PVOS(AOS-S) this value will be multiplied by 16.

ArubaInterfaceCommon_SpanningTreeConfig.description: Top-level container for spanning tree configuration.

stp.description: Interface level spanning-tree configuration. This configuration is valid only on a layer2 interface.

bpdu-filter.description:
Stop transmitting BPDUs (Bridge Protocol Data Unit), receiving BPDUs,
and assume a continuous forwarding state.

bpdu-guard.description: Disable the port if the port receives STP BPDUs.

loop-guard.description:
Guard against the loop and subsequently prevent it from becoming a
forwarding port.

pvst-filter.description: Stop receiving and retransmitting PVST (Per-VLAN Spanning Tree) BPDUs.

pvst-guard.description: Disable the port if the port receives PVST BPDUs.

root-guard.description: Ignore superior BPDUs to prevent it from becoming root port.

rpvst-filter.description: Stop receiving and retransmitting RPVST (Rapid Per-VLAN Spanning Tree) BPDUs.

rpvst-guard.description: Disable the port if the port receives RPVST BPDUs.

tcn-guard.description:
Stop propagating received topology changes notifications and topology
changes.

native-vlan-ieee-bpdu.description:
Spanning tree native-vlan-ieee-bpdu config.This allows the device to send IEEE BPDUs
on the native VLAN when operating in the PVST mode.

admin-edge-port.description:
Configures the port as a spanning tree administrative edge port for the role.
This configuration removes the port participation from STP interactions when
onboarding devices. This in turn helps in faster onboarding of devices.
In GW this is applicable for access ports

admin-edge-port-trunk.description: Configures the TRUNK port as a spanning tree administrative edge port for the role.

cost.description: Cost of the port for the instance.

priority.description: Port priority. For CX and PVOS this value will be multiplied by 16.

rpvst.description: Cost and priority for a PVST VLAN.

vlan-id.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
vlan-id.description: VLAN to set cost and priority in PVST(Per VLAN Spanning Tree)

mstp.description: STP parameters applicable per MSTP(Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol) instance.

ArubaInterfaceCommon_LoopPreventionConfi.description: Top-level grouping for interface loop prevention configuration.

loop-protect.description: Interface level Loop protect configuration. This configuration is valid only on a layer2 interface.

shutdown-on-split.description:
Determines whether the port will be shutdown when VSX split occurs.
This is only applicable to the ports that are not configured as MCLAG
and SVIs that do not have any MCLAGs as members.

qinq.description:
QinQ interface level configuration.This feature
is not supported.

items.x-typeDescription:
VLANs or only single-tagged VLANs or both. A range is
specified as x-y where x and y are valid VLAN IDs
(1 <= vlan-id <= 4094). The range is assumed to be inclusive,
such that any VLAN-ID matching x <= VLAN-ID <= y falls within
the range.
items.description:
Customer VLANs. Service VLAN is mandatory along with customer VLANs.
Selective QinQ config allowed on access port only.

service-vlan.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
service-vlan.description:
Service VLAN to which the customer vlans are to be mapped.
Customer VLANs is mandatory along with service VLAN.
The qinq-svlan parameter should be enabled on the service-vlan

x-enumDescriptions.CUSTOMER_NETWORK:
Sets QinQ port type as customer-network port.
Customer-Network port is an access port facing user network,
that carries CVLANs traffic entering the port with QinQ tunnel using SVLAN.
x-enumDescriptions.PROVIDER_NETWORK:
Sets Qinq port type as a provider network type.
Provider-Network port is a trunk port facing provider network,
that transmits and receives service tag frames for multiple users.

qinq-port-type.description:
QinQ port modes. The QinQ port type config allowed on trunk port only.
and is not allowed along with selective QinQ config.
The qinq-svlan parameter should be enabled on the native VLAN of the port

ArubaInterfaceCommon_UrpfCheckConfig.description: Grouping for Unicast Reverse Path Forwarding (uRPF) configuration.

urpf.description: Unicast Reverse Path Forwarding (uRPF) on the interface to prevent IP address spoofing.

x-enumDescriptions.DISABLE: Disable source address validation on incoming packets.
x-enumDescriptions.STRICT:
Incoming packets are accepted only if they are received on the interface that the router would use to
reach the source IP address.
x-enumDescriptions.LOOSE: Incoming packets are accepted as long as the source IP address is reachable via any interface on the router.

ipv4-enable.x-typeDescription: Unicast Reverse Path Forwarding mode for incoming packets on the interface.
ipv4-enable.description:
Unicast Reverse Path Forwarding (uRPF) mode on the interface to prevent IPv4 address spoofing by validating
the source address of incoming packets.

address.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

arp.description: Neighbor Discovery Manager parameters for ipv4.

nd.description: Neighbor Discovery Manager parameters for ipv6.

dhcpv4-snooping.description: Port-specific DHCPv4-Snooping parameters. This configuration is valid only on a layer2 interface.

max-bindings.description: Maximum number of DHCPv4 IP bindings allowed on the port

trust.description: Trusted interface for DHCPv4 server packets

dhcpv6-snooping.description: Port-specific DHCPv6-Snooping parameters. This configuration is valid only on a layer2 interface.

max-bindings.description: Maximum number of DHCPv6 IP bindings allowed on the port

trust.description: Trusted interface for DHCPv6 server packets

ArubaInterfaceCommon_DynamicArpInspectio.description: Dynamic ARP Inspection interface parameters grouping

dynamic-arp-inspection.description:
Configuration of Dynamic ARP Inspection on interface.
This configuration is valid only on a layer2 interface.

ArubaInterfaceCommon_CiptInterfaceConfig.description: Grouping for Interface-level configuration parameters of client IP tracker.

x-enumDescriptions.ENABLE: Track all client IP addresses on this port.
x-enumDescriptions.DISABLE: Client IP addresses are not tracked on this port.
x-enumDescriptions.AUTO:
Default mode. Track limited set of clients based on LLDP/CDP
signature and access/trunk configuration.

mode.x-typeDescription: Specifies the client IP tracking mode of the port on AOS-CX switches.
mode.description:
Specifies client IP tracking mode on the port of AOS-CX switch.
This configuration is valid only on a layer2 interface.

connect-to-network-device.description:
Marks a port as being connected with a network device. It is applicable to AOS-S switch.
This configuration is valid only on a layer2 interface.

client-limit-max.description:
Configure the maximum number of clients tracked on this port. It is applicable to AOS-CX switch.
This configuration is valid only on a layer2 interface.

update-interval.description:
Configure the IP address update interval in seconds. It is applicable to AOS-CX switch.
This configuration is valid only on a layer2 interface.

ipfix-flow-monitor-in.description: Configuration to apply flow monitor(s) to an interface. The flow monitors will monitor traffic in the ingress direction

ipv4-monitor.description:
Configuration to attach an IPv4 flow monitor to an interface. A monitor is IPv4 if
it's attached flow record is using IPv4 match fields. The specified monitor must be
previously configured.

ipv6-monitor.description:
Configuration to attach an IPv6 flow monitor to an interface. A monitor is IPv6 if
it's attached flow record is using IPv6 match fields. The specified monitor must be
previously configured.

enable.description:
Enables the use of the configured source-interface for DHCPv4 relay agent.
When set to true, the configured source-interface is used as source IP address while
sending DHCPv4 relay messages to server.

x-enumDescriptions.DROP: Drop DHCP packets with option 82 information.
x-enumDescriptions.KEEP: Retain option 82 information in the DHCP packets.
x-enumDescriptions.REPLACE: Replace option 82 information in the DHCP packets.

policy.description: Policy to be applied on the client DHCP packets with option 82.

validate.description: Validates option 82 information in the DHCP server response packets.

x-enumDescriptions.IP_MGMT_VLAN: IP address of the management VLAN

remote-id.description:
Option 82 remote ID sub-option to be sent in the DHCP packet to server.
It is used to identify the relay agent device.

source-interface.description:
Enables the use of the configured source-interface for DHCPv4 relay agent communication.
When set to true, the configured source-interface will be used for sending DHCPv4 relay messages.

bootp-gateway.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

ip-vrf.description: Key combination of ip and vrf separated by ~

enable.description:
Enables DHCPv4 relay globally. The functionality is effective
  	 only after the port level helper configuration.

hop-count-increment.description: Enables hop count increment in the relayed DHCPv4 requests.

smart-relay.description:
Enables DHCPv4 smart relay globally. When multiple IPv4 addresses are configured on an
interface, the primary IP address is used first as the gateway IP (GIADDR) for DHCP relay.
If the DHCP server does not have available IP addresses in the pool corresponding to the primary
IP's subnet, the secondary IP address is used as a fallback. This ensures that the DHCP relay
remains functional by switching to a secondary IP address when the primary IP's subnet pool
is exhausted.

l2vpn-clients.description: Enables DHCPv4 relay for remote L2 VPN clients.

reply-overwrite-source-ip.description: Enables DHCPv4 relay overwrite source IP.

option-xml.description:
IPv4 DHCP relay option XML file. The XML file is used as the input from the user and is validated
against an XSD file in the controller. The format in the XML file is parsed and stored in the DHCP
relay which is used to insert Option-82 related values in the DHCP request packets sent from the
client to the server.

enable.description:
Enables DHCPv6 relay globally. The functionality is effective
only after the port level helper configuration.

option-79.description:
Enables DHCPv6 relay option 79. When enabled, the relay agent provides additional information
about the client in the DHCPv6 requests when relayed from the client to the DHCP server.

l2vpn-clients.description: Enables DHCPv6 relay for remote L2 VPN clients.

option-xml.description:
IPv6 DHCP relay option XML file. The XML file is used as the input from the user and is validated against
an XSD file in the controller. The format in the XML file is parsed and stored in the DHCP relay which is used
to insert Option-82 related values in the DHCP request packets sent from the client to the server.

ArubaInterfaceQos_QosTrafficTypeConfig.description: The type of rate to use for limiting ingress traffic on this port.

x-enumDescriptions.KBPS: Rate value is in kilobits per second.
x-enumDescriptions.PERCENT: Rate value is a percentage of link bandwidth.
x-enumDescriptions.PPS: Rate value is in packets per second.
x-enumDescriptions.MBPS: Rate value is in megabits per second.

rate-type.description: The rate-type to use for limiting ingress traffic.

bit-rate.description:
Traffic Rate value is in kilobits per second. It is applicable only
when the rate-type is set to KBPS. If packet mode is desired instead,
the bit-rate value should first be deleted before adding the packet rate.

percentage.description:
Traffic Rate value is a percentage of link bandwidth.
It is applicable only when the rate-type is set to PERCENT.

packet-rate.description:
Traffic Rate value is in packets per second. It is applicable only when
the rate-type is set to PPS. If bit-rate mode is desired instead, the
packet-rate value should first be deleted before adding the bit rate.

ArubaInterfaceQos_QosRateLimitConfig.description: Rate-limit a specific traffic-type on this port.

traffic-flow.x-typeDescription: Rate limit for incoming or outgoing traffic.
traffic-flow.description: Rate limit for incoming or outgoing traffic (PVOS platforms only).

traffic-flow.x-typeDescription: Rate limit for incoming or outgoing traffic.
traffic-flow.description: Rate limit for incoming or outgoing traffic (PVOS platforms only).

traffic-flow.x-typeDescription: Rate limit for incoming or outgoing traffic.
traffic-flow.description: Rate limit for incoming or outgoing traffic (PVOS platforms only).

icmp-traffic-type.description: The ICMP IP-traffic type to rate-limit.

trap-clear.description: Clear an existing ICMP rate-limiting trap condition.

queue-rate-limit.description: The rate limit setting for each traffic queue of an interface.

queue-limit.description: The queue rate-limit value as a percentage of bandwidth or link speed.

value.description: Configure rate limits as a percentage of the total port bandwidth.

cos.description:
COS remark value for all packets arriving on the port. The new value
will be reflected in the outgoing VLAN tag.

AOSCX: Arriving packets will be re-marked upon transmit. The active
port trust mode must be 'None' before any cos remark value can be
configured.
PVOS: Arriving packets will be re-marked upon arriving, which will
affect queueing.

dscp.x-typeDescription:
A differentiated services code point (DSCP) marking within the
IP header.
dscp.description:
The DSCP remark for the port. The new value will be reflected in any
outgoing IP packet headers.

AOSCX: Arriving packets will be re-marked upon transmit. The active
port trust mode must be 'None' before any dscp remark value can be
configured.
PVOS: Arriving packets will be re-marked upon arrival, which will
affect queueing.

x-enumDescriptions.KBPS: Rate value is in kilobits per second.
x-enumDescriptions.PERCENT: Rate value is a percentage of link bandwidth.
x-enumDescriptions.PPS: Rate value is in packets per second.
x-enumDescriptions.MBPS: Rate value is in megabits per second.

max-rate-units.description: Traffic rate units. Required when egress-rate is specified.

egress-rate.description:
The maximum egress traffic rate for the interface.
To configure this, the type of max-rate-units must be specified.

burst.description:
The burst size in units of kilobytes for the maximum egress traffic rate.
Valid when egress-rate is specified.

x-enumDescriptions.DEVICE_ARUBA_AP: Trust DSCP from Aruba Access-point devices.
x-enumDescriptions.DEVICE_NONE: Remove all trusted device configuration for port.
x-enumDescriptions.DEFAULT: Trust 802.1p priority and preserve DSCP or IP-ToS.
x-enumDescriptions.DOT1P: Trust 802.1p priority and preserve DSCP or IP-ToS.
x-enumDescriptions.IP_PRECEDENCE: Trust IP-Precedence and remark the 802.1p priority to match.
x-enumDescriptions.NONE: Do not trust any priority fields.

trust.x-typeDescription: The QoS Trust Mode configuration for the port.
trust.description: QoS Trust Mode Configuration for the port.

qvalue.description: The minimum bandwidth percentage for queue.

priority-mapping-bandwidth-scheduler.description:
Priority-mapping bandwidth-scheduler interface profile. Profiles must
first be created using the aruba-gw-scheduler yang model.

schedule-profile.x-typeDescription:
Name or description of the entity. Must be 1-64 characters in length and can only
contain alphanumeric characters, periods, underscores, and hyphens
schedule-profile.description:
QoS interface schedule profile. The schedule profile must
first be configured using the aruba-qos-schedule yang model, and must be
valid for the platform on which the port resides. In addition, the
schedule profile must match the configured number of queues and queue ID
values in the globally-applied queue profile.

threshold-profile.x-typeDescription:
Name or description of the entity. Must be 1-64 characters in length and can only
contain alphanumeric characters, periods, underscores, and hyphens
threshold-profile.description:
QoS interface threshold profile. The threshold profile must
first be configured using the aruba-qos-threshold-profile yang model, and
must be supportable by the platform on which the port resides.

qos.description:
QoS interface parameters for the physical interface or port channel.
For port channels, the same configuration is applied to all members.

x-enumDescriptions.AUTO: Auto detect LACP PDU to determine if LACP passive should be enabled or NOT.

mode.description: Active/Passive mode of LACP for this group

mad-passthrough.description: MAD (Multi-Active Detection) passthrough on LACP trunks.

min-active-links.description:
Minimum number of active member links in a LACP
trunk group for it to be operational.

enable-timer.description:
Time in seconds to wait before re-enabling the trunk disabled by LACP
feature for minimum active links.

x-enumDescriptions.FAST: LACP heartbeats are requested at the rate of one per second.
x-enumDescriptions.SLOW: LACP heartbeats are requested at the rate of one per 30 seconds.

port-id.x-typeDescription:
A 16-bit port number used by a transport protocol such as TCP
or UDP.
port-id.description: Port ID used in LACP negotiation.

port-priority.description: Port priority used in LACP negotiation.

ArubaUdpBroadcastForwarder_UdpBroadcastF.description: Grouping for UDP Broadcast Forwarder Interface Configurations

clock-source-only.description:
PTP clock source only. When set to 'true', prohibits
the Port from entering the clock sink or passive state.

default-log-announce-interval.description: PTP log announce interval value for default(1588V2) profile

dot1as-log-announce-interval.description: PTP log announce interval value for DOT1AS profile

aes67-log-announce-interval.description: PTP log announce interval value for AES67 profiles

aes-r16-log-announce-interval.description: PTP log announce interval value for AES-R16 profiles

smpte-log-announce-interval.description: PTP log announce interval value for SMPTE profile

g-8275-2-log-announce-interval.description: PTP log announce interval value for g.8275.2 profile

default-announce-receipt-timeout.description: PTP announce receipt timeout for default(1588V2) and DOT1AS profile.

dot1as-announce-receipt-timeout.description: PTP announce receipt timeout for DOT1AS profile.

aes67-announce-receipt-timeout.description: PTP announce receipt timeout for AES67 profile.

aes-r16-announce-receipt-timeout.description: PTP announce receipt timeout for AES-R16 profile.

smpte-announce-receipt-timeout.description: PTP announce receipt timeout for SMPTE profile.

g-8275-1-announce-receipt-timeout.description: PTP announce receipt timeout for g.8275.1 profile.

g-8275-2-announce-receipt-timeout.description: PTP announce receipt timeout for g.8275.2 profile.

default-log-sync-interval.description: PTP sync interval in log scale for default(1588V2) profile.

dot1as-log-sync-interval.description: PTP sync interval in log scale for DOT1AS profile.

aes67-log-sync-interval.description: PTP sync interval in log scale for AES67 profile.

smpte-log-sync-interval.description: PTP sync interval in log scale for SMPTE profile.

g-8275-2-log-sync-interval.description: PTP sync interval in log scale for g.8275.2 profile.

sync-receipt-timeout.description: PTP sync receipt timeout for DOT1AS profile.

g-8275-1-sync-receipt-timeout.description: PTP sync receipt timeout for g.8275.1 profile.

g-8275-2-sync-receipt-timeout.description: PTP sync receipt timeout for g.8275.1 profile.

default-log-min-delay-req-interval.description: PTP minimum delay-req interval in log scale for default(1588V2) profile.

aes67-log-min-delay-req-interval.description: PTP minimum delay-req  interval in log scale for AES67 profile.

aes-r16-log-min-delay-req-interval.description: PTP minimum delay-req  interval in log scale for AES-R16 profile.

smpte-log-min-delay-req-interval.description: PTP minimum delay-req interval in log scale for SMPTE profile.

default-log-min-pdelay-req-interval.description: PTP minimum pdelay-req interval in log scale for default(1588V2)  profile.

dot1as-log-min-pdelay-req-interval.description: PTP minimum pdelay-req interval in log scale for DOT1AS profile.

aes67-log-min-pdelay-req-interval.description: PTP minimum pdelay-req interval in log scale for AES67 profile.

aes-r16-log-min-pdelay-req-interval.description: PTP minimum pdelay-req interval in log scale for AES-R16 profile.

smpte-log-min-pdelay-req-interval.description: PTP minimum pdelay-req interval in log scale for SMPTE profile.

g-8275-2-log-min-delay-req-interval.description: PTP minimum delay-req interval in log scale for default(G_8275_2) profile.

neighbor-prop-delay-threshold.description:
Set threshold of measured mean propagation delay(in nano seconds) on the link attached to this port,
relative to the LocalClock entity of the time-aware system at the other
 end of the link (i.e., expressed in the time base of the time-aware system
     at the other end of the link). This is specific to DOT1AS profile.

items.x-typeDescription:
VLANs or only single-tagged VLANs or both. A range is
specified as x-y where x and y are valid VLAN IDs
(1 <= vlan-id <= 4094). The range is assumed to be inclusive,
such that any VLAN-ID matching x <= VLAN-ID <= y falls within
the range.
items.description:
Specifies the VLAN to be used for PTP packet exchange on this port.
This configuration is specific to PTP Ethernet mode and L3 multicast
over L2 port mode.

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

items.description:
Specifies the list of PTP peer IP addresses
for this port.

ip-dscp-event.description: IP DSCP value for PTP event messages

ip-dscp-general.description: IP DSCP value for PTP general messages

ArubaDevicefingerprintingInterface_Inter.description: Grouping for Port-level configuration parameters of Device Fingerprinting.

profile-name.description:
Apply a Device Fingerprinting Profile to a port/portlist.
This configuration is valid only on a layer2 interface.

client-limit.description:
Specifiy Maximum number of clients allowed on the port/portlist for Device Fingerprinting.
This configuration is valid only on a layer2 interface.

incoming-clients-only.description:
Enables fingerprinting for the clients that comes in after
enabling the fingerprinting feature on the port of AOS-S switch.
This configuration is valid only on a layer2 interface.

nd-snooping.description: Port-specific ND-Snooping parameters. This configuration is valid only on a layer2 interface.

max-bindings.description: Maximum number of ND bindings allowed on the port

ip-source-lockdown.description: IP source lockdown interface. This configuration is valid only on a layer2 interface.

ArubaRouterDiscovery_Ipv4RouterDiscovery.description: Grouping of ICMP router discovery configurations for IPv4.

ArubaRouterDiscovery_Ipv6RaPrefixOptions.description: Grouping of IPv6 Router Advertisement prefix options.

oneOf.x-typeDescription: IPv6 Router Advertisement life time in seconds.
IPv6 Router Advertisement life time in absolute date and time.

x-enumDescriptions.INFINITE: Infinite IPv6 Router Advertisement life time.

oneOf.x-typeDescription: Infinite IPv6 Router Advertisement life time.

valid-lifetime.description:
Valid lifetime of the IPv6 prefix being advertised. After the valid lifetime expiry,
the address becomes invalid.

oneOf.x-typeDescription: IPv6 Router Advertisement life time in seconds.
IPv6 Router Advertisement life time in absolute date and time.

x-enumDescriptions.INFINITE: Infinite IPv6 Router Advertisement life time.

oneOf.x-typeDescription: Infinite IPv6 Router Advertisement life time.

preferred-lifetime.description:
Preferred lifetime of the IPv6 prefix being advertised. After the preferred lifetime expiry,
the address becomes deprecated.

advertise.description: Enable advertisement of the IPv6 prefix.

autoconfig.description: Set address auto-configuration option in the advertisements.

onlink.description: Set on-link property of the IPv6 prefix in the advertisements.

ArubaRouterDiscovery_Ipv6RaDefaultPrefix.description: Grouping of IPv6 default Prefix configurations in the Router Advertisement.

default-prefix.description: IPv6 default Prefix configurations in the Router Advertisement.

default.description: Default IPv6 prefix options, applicable to all on-link IPv6 prefixes that are not individually set.

ArubaRouterDiscovery_Ipv6RaPrefix.description: Grouping of IPv6 Prefix configurations in the Router Advertisement.

prefixes.description: List of IPv6 prefixes to be advertised.

prefix.x-typeDescription:
An IPv6 prefix represented in full, shortened, or mixed
shortened format followed by a slash and CIDR mask
(0 <= mask <= 128).

prefix-option.description: IPv6 Prefix option configurations in the Router Advertisement.

ArubaRouterDiscovery_Ipv6NeighborDiscove.description: Grouping of IPv6 Neighbor Discovery and Router Advertisement configurations.

Successful200.description: Success response returned from the server.

Error400.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Bad request. Invalid values supplied in request.

Error401.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error403.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error404.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Not found. Yang / Corresponding Rule is missing.

Error406.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error408.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error412.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error429.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error500.description: Error details returned from the server.
